CellMaNam 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Perform cell type annotation based on annotation (get_annotation()).data. If necessary, you can use hierarchical data (via `load_markers_hierarchy()`) to find and construct hierarchical relationships in cell names.

    cell_typing.Rd

    Perform cell type annotation based on annotation (get_annotation()).data. If necessary, you can use hierarchical data (via `load_markers_hierarchy()`) to find and construct hierarchical relationships in cell names.

    cell_typing(
  annotation_data,
  hierarchy_data,
  p_val = 0.01,
  level = 1,
  hierarchy = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    annotation_data

    Dataframe with cell annotations and p-values (get_annotation())

    hierarchy_data

    Dataframe representing the hierarchy of cell types (load_markers_hierarchy() or NULL if not needed)

    p_val

    Threshold p-value for selecting significant annotations. Default: 0.01

    level

    Integer, specifying the level in the hierarchy to use. Default: 1

    hierarchy

    Boolean, whether to use hierarchical annotation. If you want to use hierarchical data for name creating. If not the names will based on 'level'. Default: TRUE

    Value

    A dataframe with assigned cell types, weighted p-values, and log-transformed p-values

    Details

    Uses hierarchical relationships and statistical thresholds to classify cell types.

    Contents

    Developed by Jakub Kubiś - JBioSystem.
